content:
The example on https://hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/conformance/index.html#example includes 

            "system": "http://hl7.org/fhir/restful-security-service",
            "code": "SMART-on-FHIR"

Is that the code-system we should be using for this?

I see according to http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-restful-security-service.html it should be http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/restful-security-service

Can someone fix the example on the hl7 site?
We're completing the move away from CapabilityStatement-based discovery in SMARTv2, for what it's worth.

Lloyd McKenzie said:

Can you submit a change request?

I forget how to do that. Can you do it for me? :-)

I had already opened up a ticket in the smart github for this if that's what you were looking for Lloyd
https://github.com/HL7/smart-app-launch/issues/311

In the end, it'll need to be in Jira, but if it's in their Git, I guess they can propagate it to Jira on your behalf. @Ken Stevens, at the bottom of every FHIR spec page there's a "propose a change" link that takes you to HL7's Jira
Thanks @Josh Mandel . I just confirmed that James has already added support for that new interface.
